paragraphs.text: If you fill in more than 3 of the above mentioned roles, you can call yourself a digital product designer, or simply - Product Designer. This golden title has already been embraced by companies like Facebook, Uber, Airbnb and many others. I’ve noticed Google is slowly moving towards it. But sadly many, including some giants like Adobe & Microsoft, still use the inexact title (I’m not even typing it again).
paragraphs.name: d079

paragraphs.text: If you fill in more than 3 of the above mentioned roles, you can call yourself a digital product designer, or simply - Product Designer. This golden title has already been embraced by companies like Facebook, Uber, Airbnb and many others. I’ve noticed Google is slowly moving towards it. But sadly many, including some giants like Adobe & Microsoft, still use the inexact title (I’m not even typing it again).
paragraphs.name: d079

paragraphs.text: If you are a creature they call a UX designer, keep calm. You now know that one designer (or even a team) cannot be responsible for the UX unless they are the only contributing member(s) in the team. Also, UX is far too broad a term to define somebody’s job. It’s like calling an aeronautical engineer — a ‘sky specialist’.
paragraphs.name: c774

paragraphs.text: 1. Every designer is (if not.. should be) a UX designer.
paragraphs.name: 0d93

a6e5ef65ba82.title: While I don’t agree with your final conclusion (that no one should call themselves UX Designer), I…

paragraphs.text: While I don’t agree with your final conclusion (that no one should call themselves UX Designer), I think your reasoning is on point. We can agree or disagree on the title as professionals, but it also depends on the industry, including people that don’t necessarily think about the title itself. Recruiter or a person from HR will probably stick to the…
paragraphs.name: b3ae

paragraphs.text: Great Article. I've been thinking about these names and their meaning in a while and you nailed my thought.
paragraphs.name: 3ab8

a4e5c142f963.title: The same arguments used against the term UX Designer can be used against Product Designer.

paragraphs.text: The same arguments used against the term UX Designer can be used against Product Designer. Products “result from the combined efforts of everyone involved in building it.”
paragraphs.name: f8cb

paragraphs.text: I think the goal of the terms Product Designer and UX Designer is that a single person is taking responsibility for a product. That said, I agree that Product Designer is a better term.
paragraphs.name: 7c15

ec601fe42e2c.title: Your second point hits on an important implication for teams: designating someone as “the UX…

paragraphs.text: Your second point hits on an important implication for teams: designating someone as “the UX Designer” implies that others do not have that responsibility. I think, for example, of the legal review on my team. I don’t read contracts or negotiations with a legal/regulatory eye, because I know we have a dedicated person with that responsibility. The…
paragraphs.name: 1eec

paragraphs.text: Interesting thoughts. I personally have been questioning myself on this point too. I work at a startup under the title ‘User Experience Designer’. I agree with you that we cannot design a user’s experience. Everyone has their own experience. But my opinion is that we can design for the user’s experience. Meaning: trying our best to make the right…
paragraphs.name: 6fa8

virtuals.subtitle: Your second point: I also agree with you that a great User Experience should everyone’s responsibility. But I think it all depends on the…

content.subtitle: Your second point: I also agree with you that a great User Experience should everyone’s responsibility. But I think it all depends on the…

b19dbd55d659.title: Agree in a bunch of ways.

paragraphs.text: Agree in a bunch of ways. I do still think UX Designer is an appropriate title So much as a product manager is though. A UX designer may not implement all the things that ultimately bring about a good user experience but they should be managing and forcing discussion on a lot of them.

virtuals.subtitle: For instance, I as a UX designer do not build the front end system that sends the API call to the database and receives the response in X…

paragraphs.text: Great article! I got your point; regular designers also call themselves “UX Designers” but what it really means when someone calls himself like that is that even if he’s a designer he also studied the “psychology of the consumer” and other related topics that a simple designer don’t even know they exist…

56c8fb04022d.title: Call me crazy, but I actually love this topic.

paragraphs.text: Call me crazy, but I actually love this topic. I’ve been doing and managing things that cluster around “UX” since the titles were “Web Designer” and “Web Master.” At times I’m not sure whether the clarity of titles has gotten better or worse since then. There’s so much tied up in a title — it’s how you and others define your scope of responsibility…
paragraphs.name: f68a

paragraphs.text: Well written and totally agree! With anything that I do design related there are always lots of elements in my role that pull everything together for the complete experience. UX is definitely more of a singular term used these days….. that’s for sure!
paragraphs.name: fb0a

171e6b3e8258.title: In some sense, I agree with you, I mean as a designer; we should understand that designing is a…

paragraphs.text: In some sense, I agree with you, I mean as a designer; we should understand that designing is a means to a solution — thus all designers should be able to design a great user experience. With that said though, I believe that the title UX Designer should refer to the seniority of the designer.
paragraphs.name: 343f

paragraphs.text: Interesting article! I recently read another article that predicts that UX design will no longer exist in the next 15 years, and the reason is exactly what you described — UX design will divide into more specialized fields like visual design, interaction design, motion design, content strategy, etc.
